pr_title: Add project dependencies in a separate layer for WAR projects

timeline.message: add project dependencies for WAR project
add test for project dependencies of WAR project

timeline.bodyText:
I'd prefer calling addProjectDependencies after addSnapshotDependencies. That is, the order should be

add 3rd-party dependencies
add snapshot dependencies
add project dependencies

And let's chain .filter().

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                          .filter(
          
          
            
                              path ->
          
          
            
                                  !path.getFileName().toString().contains("SNAPSHOT")
          
          
            
                                      && !projectArtifacts.contains(path.getFileName().toString()))
          
          
            
                          .filter(path -> !path.getFileName().toString().contains("SNAPSHOT"))
          
          
            
                          .filter(path -> !projectArtifacts.contains(path.getFileName().toString()))
          
      
    
    
  

Also, now it's better to give names to these predicates. For example,
.filter(path -> !isSnapshot(path))
.filter(path -> !isProjectDependency(path))
...
.filter(isSnapshot)
....
.filter(isProjectDependency)
timeline.author: chanseokoh
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -123,10 +126,18 @@ public static JibContainerBuilder fromExplodedWar(
       javaContainerBuilder.addClasses(webInfClasses, isClassFile);
     }
     if (Files.exists(webInfLib)) {
+      javaContainerBuilder.addProjectDependencies(
+          new DirectoryWalker(webInfLib)
+              .filterRoot()
+              .filter(path -> projectArtifacts.contains(path.getFileName().toString()))
+              .walk());
       javaContainerBuilder.addDependencies(
           new DirectoryWalker(webInfLib)
               .filterRoot()
-              .filter(path -> !path.getFileName().toString().contains("SNAPSHOT"))
+              .filter(
+                  path ->
+                      !path.getFileName().toString().contains("SNAPSHOT")
+                          && !projectArtifacts.contains(path.getFileName().toString()))

timeline.bodyText:
projectArtifacts --> projectArtifactFilename
and update the Javadoc accordingly.
